definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: The UN force was strung out across northern Korea and not prepared for a Chinese attack.
sentences.chinese: 联合国部队在朝鲜摆开阵势，并未防备中国的进攻。

sentences.english: Massage the scalp, improve blood circulation, prevent hair white.
sentences.chinese: 推拿头皮，改进血循环，防备头发变白。

sentences.english: Close the gate of the pen properly to prevent the sheep from getting away.
sentences.chinese: 把羊圈关好，防备羊群跑掉。

sentences.english: No one was prepared when the storm took its course and flooded the small town.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨在大家都没有防备之下来袭，淹没了小镇。

sentences.english: WHO is assisting with the epidemiological analysis and in improving preparedness and response.
sentences.chinese: 世卫组织正在协助流行病学分析以及改进防备和应对。

sentences.english: Miners wore a helmet as a guard against falling rocks.
sentences.chinese: 矿工头戴钢盔，防备落下的岩石。

sentences.english: The total in your guard, give you a gentle Yidao fatal.
sentences.chinese: 总在你毫无防备的时候，给你致命的温柔一刀。

sentences.english: I loved that Kate was so strong, guarded and independent.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢第一季里的那个坚强，防备而独立的凯特。

sentences.english: The sailors provided against the coming storm by furling all sails .
sentences.chinese: 水手们收起全部船帆，以防备即将来临的暴风雨。

sentences.english: Extrusion punches must be coated to prevent galling.
sentences.chinese: 为防备磨损拉伸冲头必须做镀层处理。

sentences.english: I often take my mind off my work by rerequestroved driving instructorng a helpful novel.
sentences.chinese: 通常我通过阅读小说使我的防备力从劳动上转移过去。

sentences.english: B. emotion you rich suggestible sub-soft on the people of unsuspecting heart.
sentences.chinese: 你情感丰富，耳根子软，对人毫无防备之心。

sentences.english: The Spaniard's disarming humility and confidence has brought him some joy.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙人没有防备心的性格和自信使他非常的舒心。

sentences.english: It's single undefended spot is its fleshy, armor-less underside.
sentences.chinese: 它唯一没有防备的地方是它没有甲片保护的腹部。

sentences.english: Suppose a single unsuspecting man was on the siding?
sentences.chinese: 那么假设有一个毫无防备的人正好站在岔线上呢？

sentences.english: On a whim, Ner'zhul decided to test his powers on the unsuspecting humans.
sentences.chinese: 耐奥祖决定用这些毫无防备的人类来检验他的力量。

definition: to guard against/to be vigilant/watch you don't (slip)/also pr. [ti2 fang2]
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to be on guard/wariness/to guard against/preventive
to warn/to alert/to be on the alert/to stand guard/sentinel
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
